sen.j: 瘧（おこり、マラリア）を病んで加持（かじ）のために北山を訪れた源氏は、通りかかった家で密かに恋焦がれる藤壺（23歳）の面影を持つ少女（後の紫の上。10歳ほど）を垣間見た。
sen.e: Genji, who had been suffering from ague (malaria) and visited Kitayama for incantation, caught a glimpse of a girl (later Murasaki no Ue, around ten years old) having similar appearance to Fujitsubo (twenty-three years old) whom Genji languished for in secret, in a house which he happened to pass by.

Genji, who had been suffering from ague (malaria) and was visiting Kitayama for incantation, caught a glimpse of a girl (later Murasaki no Ue, around ten years old) who had an appearance similar to Fujitsubo (twenty-three years old) whom Genji yearned for in secret, in a house which he happened to pass by.
sen.cmt: "Visited"-"was visiting". "having similar appearance"-"who had an appearance similar". "Languished"-"yearned".
sen.e: Genji, who had been suffering from ague (malaria) and was visiting Kitayama for incantation, caught a glimpse of a girl (later known as Murasaki no Ue, around 10 years old) who had an appearance similar to Fujitsubo (23 years old), whom Genji yearned for in secret, when he happened to pass by the house.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 少女の大伯父の僧都によると彼女は藤壺の兄兵部卿宮の娘で、父の正妻による圧力を気に病んだ母が早くに亡くなったそうだ。
sen.e: According to a priest, who was a grand-uncle of the girl, she was a daughter of Hyobukyo no Miya, who was an elder brother of Fujitsubo and, after her mother, who worried about the pressure from the legitimate wife of her father, died, she was brought up by her grandmother, who was a nun (around forty years old) and more than ten years had elapsed.

According to a priest, who was a grand-uncle of the girl, she was a daughter of Hyobukyo no Miya, who was an elder brother of Fujitsubo and, after her mother, who sick from worry caused by pressure from the legitimate wife of her father, died, she was brought up by her grandmother, who was a nun (around forty years old); after which time more than ten years had elapsed.
sen.cmt: Added "sick from worry" to make the meaning a bit clearer. Added "afrer which time" to make it read a bit more naturally.
sen.e: According to a priest, who was a grand-uncle of the girl, she was a daughter of Hyobukyo no Miya, an elder brother of Fujitsubo, and her mother passed away because she worried about pressure from the legitimate wife of her husband.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: その後、祖母の尼君（40歳ほど）の元で育てられ10余年たったという。
sen.e: Then the girl was brought up by her grandmother, who was a nun (around 40 years old), and more than 10 years have passed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 源氏は少女の後見を申し出たが、結婚相手とするにはあまりに少女が幼いため、尼君は本気にしなかった。
sen.e: Genji offered to become girl's guardian, the nun did not take it seriously because the girl was too young to marry.

sen.e: In April, Fujitsubo (twenty-three years old) took a short leave because of her illness, and Genji succeeded to meet her again thanks to guidance by O no Myobu, who was a Fujitsubo's maid.

sen.j: その後藤壺は源氏の文も拒み続けたが、既に藤壺は源氏の子を妊娠していた。
sen.e: After that, Fujitsubo continued refusing to receive Genji's letter, but Fujitsubo was already pregnant with Genji's child.

sen.j: 晩秋源氏は見舞いに訪れるが、尼君はそれから間もなく亡くなってしまう。
sen.e: In late autumn, Genji call on them, but it was not long before the nun died.

sen.j: 身寄りのなくなった少女を、源氏は父兵部卿宮に先んじて自らの邸二条院に連れ帰る。
sen.e: Genji took the girl, who became helpless, to own mansion, Nijoin, going ahead of her father, Hyobukyo no Miya and considered to bring up her to an ideal lady instead of Fujitsubo whom Genji loved.
